Posts.Content: faithandfifty wrote: According to my Facebook info, tomorrow is our Saint's birthday. I thought I would get a jump on the big day here (since it's too late to put an actual card in the actual mail with an actual stamp on it. LOL. She knows me pretty well, so she won't be surprised.) Posts.Content: faithandfifty wrote: I've just learned that today is Slonedeb's birthday!! She's received challenging news of further progression and is feeling especially low right now, following this news. I'd like to invite anyone & everyone who sees this to go to her 'thread' and post a greeting. Even if you don't know her -- I'm certain that she'd be encouraged to see well wishes from the community. A shower of greetings would be awesome. Her thread is under the section: Recovery, Renewal & Hope. Then go to: Prayers & Spirtual Inspiration.... then search for Slonedeb. One more thing. Her computer does not allow her to see graphics or pictures etc. So a flood of words are in order: wishes, prayers, poems, song lyrics, funny jokes -- anything that she can read would be fantastic. Thanks for your support of a couragous sister. Even if you find this well after her birthday, I know she'd appreciated some belated wishes as well. Edited to clarify how to find the thread. Keep up with my travels at: www.rainbowswithinreach.blogspot.com Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Slonedeb's Birthday faithandfifty faithandfifty

Posts.Content: faithandfifty wrote: I just got my email from Dr. Love & the Million Women Campaign. They have sponsored a contest about the 'best' PSA for October/BC. Go to Glamour's website to view and vote. Then post on your FB status, your blog, your email circle of people. Everyone should see these. They're very well done. WARNING: have tissues available. http://www.glamour.com/health-fitness/blogs/vitamin-g/2009/09/vote-now-and-help-find-a-cure.html Keep up with my travels at: www.rainbowswithinreach.blogspot.com Log in to post a reply
